    • Method Detail

      • getMinutesOffset

        public static long getMinutesOffset(java.lang.String time1,
                                    java.lang.String time2)
        Returns the true offset in minutes between the two objects. For instance an offset between time1=0:10 and time2=0:00 would return 1430 (minutes in day 1440).
        Parameters:
        time1 -
        time2 -
        Returns:
        The true offset in minutes between the two objects

      • getMinutesBetween

        public static long getMinutesBetween(java.lang.String time1,
                                     java.lang.String time2)
        Returns minutes between the two objects. For instance minutes between time1=0:10 and time2=0:00 would return a value of -10
        Parameters:
        time1 -
        time2 -
        Returns:
        Minutes between the two objects

      • getStockholmTime

        public static java.lang.String getStockholmTime()
        Returns the current time in Stockholm.
        Returns:
        The current time in Stockholm formatted as a String

      • isValidTime

        public static boolean isValidTime(java.lang.String time)
        Verifies that the string can be parsed into a LocalTime object.
        Parameters:
        time -
        Returns:
        true i the string can be parsed into a LocalTime object, false if not.

      • isValidDate

        public static boolean isValidDate(java.lang.String date)
        Verifies that the string can be parsed into a LocalDate object
        Parameters:
        date -
        Returns:
        true if the string can be parsed into a LocalDate object, false if not.

      • getCurrentTimeShort

        public static java.lang.String getCurrentTimeShort()
        Gets the current time as a short string.
        Returns:
        - Time as string formatted hh:mm:ss, eg 17:25:10

      • getCurrentDateShort

        public static java.lang.String getCurrentDateShort()
        Gets the current date as a short string.
        Returns:
        - Date as a string formatted yyyy/mm/dd, eg 2016/05/10

      • getCurrentTestStartTime

        public static java.lang.String getCurrentTestStartTime(org.testng.ITestResult result)
        Gets the start time of current test as a string suitable for file names.
        Parameters:
        result - - ITestResult object containing test result data
        Returns:
        - Date and time as a string formatted yyyy-MM-dd--HH-mm-ss, eg 2018-05-10--12-53-38

      • getTestStartTime

        public static java.lang.String getTestStartTime(java.lang.Long testID)
        Gets the start time of test with the provided test ID as a string suitable for file names.
        Parameters:
        testID - - testID of test for which to get start time.
        Returns:
        - Date and time as a string formatted yyyy-MM-dd--HH-mm-ss, eg 2018-05-10--12-53-38
